meanings.definition: To make smaller in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: I will minish the cake by cutting it into tiny slices.
meanings.sent2: She decided to minish her wardrobe by donating old clothes.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to minish the elephant, but it ended up being a tiny toy.
meanings.sent4: The problem seemed to minish as she focused on finding a solution.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays minish as the day turns to dusk.

meanings.definition: To decrease in size or importance.
meanings.sent1: The company had to minish its workforce due to financial difficulties.
meanings.sent2: His excitement minished as he realized he had forgotten his keys.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers minished when he caught a cold.
meanings.sent4: Her worries minished as she listened to the calming music.
meanings.sent5: The impact of his words minished as time passed.
